snippet: The conflict stems from the opposition’s unwillingness to accept the constitutional authority of the People’s Republic.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Hong Kong official Shiu Sin-por defends China's sovereignty in Hong Kong, particularly its constitutional right to nominate candidates for chief executive; contends China will not back down from this position, despite dramatic protests by an opposition that does not reflect majority opinion in Hong Kong.
lead_paragraph: The conflict stems from the opposition’s unwillingness to accept the constitutional authority of the People’s Republic.

headline.seo: Hong Kong’s Pan Democrats Must Accept China’s Constitutional Powers
headline.main: China’s Right to Govern Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: China’s Right to Govern Hong Kong

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
keywords.name: organizations
